hiddenConnections.title: Metformin ‚Üí AMPK activation ‚Üí EGFR TKI Synergy

evidenceC.claim: mTOR pathway activated in EGFR TKI resistance

hiddenLink.hypothesis: Metformin (A‚ÜíB) + mTOR inhibition (B‚ÜíC) = Overcome EGFR TKI resistance (C)
hiddenLink.missingConnection: No paper directly linked Metformin to EGFR TKI until 2013
hiddenLink.validation: Retrospective studies showed improved PFS in diabetic patients on metformin + EGFR TKI

hiddenConnections.title: Artemisinin (Malaria) ‚Üí Ferroptosis ‚Üí T790M Resistance

evidenceA.claim: Artemisinin generates ROS via iron-dependent mechanism

evidenceB.claim: Cancer cells accumulate iron, vulnerable to ferroptosis

evidenceC.claim: EGFR T790M cells show altered redox metabolism

hiddenLink.hypothesis: Artemisinin's iron-ROS mechanism (A) + Cancer ferroptosis vulnerability (B) = Selective killing of T790M cells (C)
hiddenLink.missingConnection: Malaria researchers never considered cancer; Cancer researchers ignored anti-malarial drugs
hiddenLink.validation: IC50 5-40 ŒºM in T790M+ cells, synergy with osimertinib (SI: 0.3-0.6)

impact.patientBenefit: Potential breakthrough for C797S resistance (no approved drug)

hiddenConnections.aiInsight: üî• BREAKTHROUGH: Nobel Prize drug repurposed via cross-domain connection
hiddenConnections.currentStatus: Phase I safety/PK ongoing in China

hiddenConnections.title: Ginsenoside Rg3 ‚Üí NK cell activation ‚Üí PD-L1 low NSCLC response
hiddenConnections.status: VALIDATED (Phase III Asia, Phase II planned West)

evidenceA.claim: Ginsenoside Rg3 enhances NK cell cytotoxicity

evidenceB.claim: NK cells can kill cancer cells independent of T-cell immunity

evidenceC.claim: EGFR+ NSCLC has low PD-L1, poor response to checkpoint inhibitors

hiddenLink.hypothesis: Rg3 NK activation (A+B) could make 'cold' EGFR+ tumors (C) responsive to immunotherapy
hiddenLink.missingConnection: Traditional medicine research isolated from Western immuno-oncology
hiddenLink.validation: Phase III Asia: OS improvement 3.2 months (HR 0.78, p=0.031)

impact.patientBenefit: Opens immunotherapy to EGFR+ patients (40% of Asian NSCLC)
impact.timeToDiscovery: ~10 years gap (A+B known, C emerged later)

hiddenConnections.aiInsight: ‚≠ê CULTURAL BRIDGE: Traditional medicine validated via Western immunology framework
hiddenConnections.currentStatus: Approved in China/Korea as adjuvant, Phase II US/EU planned

hiddenConnections.title: Berberine ‚Üí Gut microbiome ‚Üí EGFR TKI efficacy
hiddenConnections.status: HYPOTHESIS (Strong preclinical, no human trials yet)

evidenceB.claim: Gut microbiome affects drug metabolism and efficacy

evidenceC.claim: EGFR TKI response varies 3-fold despite same mutation

hiddenLink.hypothesis: Berberine microbiome modulation (A+B) explains variable TKI response (C) via drug metabolism
hiddenLink.missingConnection: Microbiome researchers don't study EGFR TKI; NSCLC researchers ignore gut microbiome
hiddenLink.validation: Mouse model: Berberine pretreatment + gefitinib ‚Üí 2.5x tumor reduction vs. gefitinib alone

impact.timeToDiscovery: ONGOING - AI can accelerate to clinical trial

hiddenConnections.aiInsight: üî• PREDICTIVE DISCOVERY: AI identified before human researchers
hiddenConnections.currentStatus: Seeking funding for Phase I/II trial

hiddenConnections.title: Curcumin ‚Üí Autophagy inhibition ‚Üí Osimertinib synergy

evidenceB.claim: Autophagy protects cancer cells from TKI-induced stress

evidenceC.claim: Osimertinib induces protective autophagy in H1975 cells

hiddenLink.hypothesis: Curcumin autophagy block (A+B) + Osimertinib stress (C) = Enhanced cell death
hiddenLink.missingConnection: A+B published before osimertinib existed (2015 approval); Temporal gap prevented connection

impact.patientBenefit: Lower osimertinib dose, reduced side effects

hiddenConnections.aiInsight: ‚è∞ TEMPORAL MINING: AI can bridge 'old' and 'new' literature across time

canDetect: Silent literature (high-impact papers in low-visibility journals)
advantages: No cognitive bias (reads ALL papers equally)
Temporal analysis (can link 1990 paper with 2024 paper)
Speed (analyzes 10,000 papers in seconds vs. human years)

realWorldImpact.scenario1: If Metformin-EGFR connection found in 2003 instead of 2013
realWorldImpact.scenario2: If Artemisinin-cancer link found in 2000 (Nobel Prize year)
realWorldImpact.impact2: T790M resistance could be solved 10 years earlier

howAIHelps.step1: Ingest ALL papers (PubMed 35M+, patents, clinical trials)
howAIHelps.step3: Detect missing edges (A‚ÜíB exists, B‚ÜíC exists, but A‚ÜíC missing)
howAIHelps.step4: Score novelty (citation patterns, field separation, time gap)
